citation.article-title: Leifsonia psychrotolerans sp. nov., a psychrotolerant species of the family Microbacteriaceae from Livingston Island, Antarctica
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Leifsonia psychrotolerans sp. nov.
Leifsonia psychrotolerans (psy.chro.to′le.rans. Gr. adj. psychros cold; L. part. adj. tolerans tolerating; N.L. part. adj. psychrotolerans cold-tolerating).
Cells are Gram-positive, motile, non-spore-forming short rods (0.3×0.9 µm).
Colonies are circular, convex, translucent and yellow in colour.
Grows at −6 to 28 °C (optimum 16 °C) and at pH 4.5–9.5 (optimum pH 5.5–6.5).
Positive for catalase, H2S production and methyl red test (weak), but negative for oxidase, urease and indole production.
Hydrolyses starch (weak), but not casein, Tween 20 or gelatin.
Grows on nutrient, LB and tryptic soy agar media, but not on mineral medium.
Unlike other members of the genus Leifsonia, can grow anaerobically with glucose as carbon source.

Produces acid from d-galactose, d-glucose, l-rhamnose, salicin (weak) and sucrose (weak), but not from lactose, maltose, d-mannitol, adonitol, l-arabinose, dulcitol, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol, trehalose or d-xylose.

Can utilize l-arabitol (weak), cellobiose, dulcitol (weak), m-erythritol, d-fructose (weak), l-fucose, d-glucose, myo-inositol, inulin, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sucrose (weak), d-salicin, sorbitol, d-xylose, acetate, l-asparagine, glycerol, glycogen (weak), pyruvate and succinate, but not adonitol, formate, glycine, lactate, melibiose, raffinose or trehalose as sole carbon source.
Sensitive to penicillin, neomycin, streptomycin, oxytetracycline, novobiocin, rifampicin and kanamycin.
Major fatty acid (>20 % of total composition) is anteiso-C15 : 0.
The type strain is LI1T ( = DSM 22824T = NCCB 100313T), isolated from moss-covered soil from Livingston Island, South Shetland Islands, Antarctica.
The genomic DNA G+C content of LI1T is 64.5 mol%.
